alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 2:02PM MST until February 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches Essex to Marias Pass with 3 to 5 inches for the lower elevations. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Expect mixed precipitation in the valleys by Monday. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches Essex to Marias Pass with 8 to 12 inches for the lower elevations. Blowing and drifting snow as winds gust to 50 mph bringing blizzard like conditions, dangerously cold wind chills and a freeze up on roadways is anticipated early Tuesday morning with an arctic front passage. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM Monday to 5 PM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
